intro: Viola hirta var. laetevirens, commonly known as the hairy violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces violet-blue flowers with a distinctive yellow center, which bloom in early spring. It prefers moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
